content:
• Thursday, June 28, 2012
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) reports FQ4 earnings of $0.27 per share on revenue of $130M, easily...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) reports FQ4 earnings of $0.27 per share on revenue of $130M, easily beating consensus estimates of $0.17 per share on expectations of $122M in revenue. Net earnings surged on strong sales volume and a decline in operating expenses. The company also issued upbeat guidance for FY13, now expecting an EPS of $0.60 - $0.65 on revenues of $485M - $505M. Street estimates are for an EPS of $0.50 on revenues of $466M. Shares +14% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek Metals (NASDAQ:TC) -4.7% AH after reporting that it expects the wall slough at...

    Thompson Creek Metals (NASDAQ:TC) -4.7% AH after reporting that it expects the wall slough at the Thompson Creek Mine to have a negative impact on Q2 production, now seen as totaling ~2.5M lbs. of molybdenum. The company also believes the ore grade at its Endako Mine will not meet budgeted levels, also negatively impacting Q2 production.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 5 Comments
  • EXFO

    More on EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ3 misses across the board as the...

    More on EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ3 misses across the board as the telecommunications testing equipment maker swung to a loss for the quarter on a weaker bookings and a 13% Y/Y decline in total revenue. The company also cuts guidance, now expecting a loss between $0.11 $0.07 per share on revenue of $55M - $60M. Street estimates were for a profit of $0.07 on $67M in revenue. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) reaffirms full-year production guidance, but revenues and income will...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) reaffirms full-year production guidance, but revenues and income will be adversely affected by lower Q2 industry pricing. Q2 met coal production is seen at ~2.8M metric tons, up more than 10% Y/Y; full-year met coal production is expected at 11.5M-13M metric tons. WLT -3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading following its giant FQ1 miss and layoff...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading following its giant FQ1 miss and layoff announcement. Shares are down 15.9% AH. The company's market cap is now barely above $4B. Mobile component suppliers such as Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS), Broadcom (BRCM), Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM), and Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) are off slightly AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 11 Comments
  • F

    Ford (NYSE:F) -2.5% AH after its CFO says international losses would triple in Q2, primarily...

    Ford (NYSE:F) -2.5% AH after its CFO says international losses would triple in Q2, primarily because of much weaker European sales, and it could close an assembly plant in Europe should demand keep falling. Ford lost $190M in Q1 in its overseas operations, with Europe accounting for nearly 80%; it had forecast Q2 international losses would be roughly the same as Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 13 Comments
  • ACN

    More on Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ3 beats across the board on a 6% rise in total income. Operating...

    More on Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ3 beats across the board on a 6% rise in total income. Operating income +12% on a 14.8% jump operating margin. New bookings came in at $7.29B, with consulting bookings at $4.05B and outsourcing bookings totaling $3.24B. The company continues to expect full-year revenue growth in range of 10% to 12%, but guides Q4 revenue lower than consensus, now expecting to earn between $6.6B - $6.85B. Street estimates are for $6.99B. Shares 3.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • EXFO

    EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ3 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.08. Revenue of...

    EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ3 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $59.5M (-13% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • NKE

    More on Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ4 misses estimates on a per share basis by nearly 6%, despite a 12%...

    More on Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ4 misses estimates on a per share basis by nearly 6%, despite a 12% Y/Y jump in total revenue. The company attributes the miss to lower gross margins, higher SG&A spending, an increase in its effective tax rate and a charge related to restructuring Nike Brand Western Europe's operations. Shares 10% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • UAA

    Under Armour (NYSE:UA) loses 4.1% in AH trading after Nike's FQ4 numbers come in weak. Shares...

    Under Armour (NYSE:UA) loses 4.1% in AH trading after Nike's FQ4 numbers come in weak. Shares were already off 2.9% for the day on the retail selloff with volume nearly 2X normal activity.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ1 EPS of -$0.37 misses by $0.36. Revenue of $2.81B (-43% Y/Y)...

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ1 EPS of -$0.37 misses by $0.36. Revenue of $2.81B (-43% Y/Y) misses by $300M. 7.8M BlackBerries shipped, down from FQ4's 11.1M. 260K PlayBooks shipped, down from FQ4's 500K. Operating loss expected for FQ2. BlackBerry 10 smartphones now expected in calendar Q1 2013. Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 37 Comments
  • TIBX

    TIBCO Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $247.4M (+14.3% Y/Y)...

    TIBCO Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $247.4M (+14.3% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • NKE

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ4 EPS of $1.17 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $6.5B (+12% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ4 EPS of $1.17 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $6.5B (+12% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -7.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has been halted ahead of its pending FQ1 earnings release.

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has been halted ahead of its pending FQ1 earnings release.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • GNW

    Genworth (GNW +10.2%) soars following word hedge fund Highfields Capital is in talks to increase...

    Genworth (GNW +10.2%) soars following word hedge fund Highfields Capital is in talks to increase its stake in the troubled life and mortgage insurer. Highfields currently holds a 5.2% stake and may see a bargain in shares selling for 20% of book. Yesterday Genworth said it would take steps to improve its capital structure after being put on review for a downgrade to junk status.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ALPMY

    Astellas Pharma (OTCPK:ALPMY +1.5%) says the the FDA has approved Myrbetriq, a drug to treat...

    Astellas Pharma (OTCPK:ALPMY +1.5%) says the the FDA has approved Myrbetriq, a drug to treat adults with overactive bladder. The condition is one in which the bladder muscle cannot be controlled, squeezes too often or squeezes without warning. The drug relaxes the muscle and thereby relieves the symptoms.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA +5.3%) shares are rising in response to the bid by Malaysia's state oil company to...

    Encana (ECA +5.3%) shares are rising in response to the bid by Malaysia's state oil company to acquire ECA rival Progress Energy Resources (OTC:PRQNF +72.5%), an offer "multiples above where most of the gas names were trading." Investors are rethinking the values given to ECA and other companies that control vast shale gas fields in western Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • STX

    In addition to ThinkEquity and JPMorgan, Barclays' Ben Reitzes has issued a downbeat note about...

    In addition to ThinkEquity and JPMorgan, Barclays' Ben Reitzes has issued a downbeat note about Seagate (STX -6.6%) and Western Digital (WDC -4.6%). Reitzes says checks indicate PC build activity was weaker than expected in Q2, and thinks notebook drive sales could disappoint. Also: hard drive assembly supplier Hutchinson (HTCH -11.7%) has issued a June quarter warning. Hard drive chipmakers LSI (LSI-OLD -3.7%) and Marvell (MRVL -3.4%) are also underperforming. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • GG

    Comex gold declined $28, or 1.8%, to settle at $1,550.40/oz. as the European summit begins with...

    Comex gold declined $28, or 1.8%, to settle at $1,550.40/oz. as the European summit begins with little hope of progress and a higher dollar keeps gold and other commodities under pressure. Also, decreased physical demand from countries such as India is hurting demand for gold. Miners take a beating: GG -5.1%, AUY -3.1%, KGC -6.2%, AEM -4.6%, NGD -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • CAGDF

    Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF -11.6%) announces the resignation of one of its directors for...

    Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF -11.6%) announces the resignation of one of its directors for undisclosed reasons. Also, TD downgrades the stock after Kyrgyzstan's parliament passed a resolution calling for the creation of a commission to further examine a negative report on the company's flagship Kumtor gold project and its environmental effects.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -7.1%) stay depressed with many factors in play. Retail stocks are...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -7.1%) stay depressed with many factors in play. Retail stocks are getting slapped down across the board off concerns that the Supreme Court opinion could increase costs, while momo names in particular are getting hit hard. To top it off, rumors of an Einhorn short on the name haven't been ground out yet - even with UBS out with a spirited defense.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +3.3%) jumps in afternoon trading on a report from The Nikkei it will buy bankrupt...

    Micron (MU +3.3%) jumps in afternoon trading on a report from The Nikkei it will buy bankrupt Elpida (OTC:ELPDF) for ¥200B ($2.51B). The companies have been talking for months about a deal, which stands to improve industry-wide DRAM pricing by limiting capacity, while increasing Micron's economies of scale and strengthening its relatively weak position in the fast-growing mobile DRAM market. There are concerns, however, about the impact on Micron's balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • FDO

    The narrow miss by Family Dollar (FDO -3.4%) with its FQ3 report isn't scaring off a bevy of...

    The narrow miss by Family Dollar (FDO -3.4%) with its FQ3 report isn't scaring off a bevy of bulls who see a lot of opportunity in the the hopper. The company's shelves will soon be stocked with high-margin private brands, tobacco products, and Pepsi - while it continues to try to steal market share from superstores. Also, a deal with Coinstar to place Redbox kiosks in Dollar General stores is seen as a revenue driver.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    JPMorgan's Mark Moskowitz has cut his targets for 12 IT hardware companies, including Dell...

    JPMorgan's Mark Moskowitz has cut his targets for 12 IT hardware companies, including Dell (DELL-OLD -3.8%), H-P (HPQ -1.1%), and Western Digital (WDC -3.1%). He cites weak Euro IT spending, Chinese growth worries, and the impact of a strong dollar on exports. Targets are also cut for Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), IBM, EMC, and NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP), but Moskowitz is more positive on their ability to weather the storm. (STX/WDC downgrade)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANTH

    Shares of Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) continue to plummet today, now down nearly 70%....

    Shares of Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) continue to plummet today, now down nearly 70%. Phase 2 dosing studies of the drug developers once-a-week lupus medication failed to meet its primary goal, forcing the company to revise plans for follow-up trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • VRTX

    Vertex (VRTX -12.1%) getting walloped possibly because data from a trial of its cystic fibrosis...

    Vertex (VRTX -12.1%) getting walloped possibly because data from a trial of its cystic fibrosis drugs Kalydeco and VX-809, in the words of Wells Fargo analyst Brian Abrahams, "look a bit less robust than previously reported." Nonetheless, Abrahams continues to believe that the combo "could have multi-billion dollar potential" if it passes Phase III.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • KATE

    Shares of Fifth & Pacific (FNP -5.4%) slump to a multi-month low. Analysts say the company could...

    Shares of Fifth & Pacific (FNP -5.4%) slump to a multi-month low. Analysts say the company could be caught in the never-never land in retail, with its premium brands a shade below the highest-end lines and a far cry from the comforts of the discounters. Also as a backdrop, the company has made a big bet on Kate Spade globally.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • LMT

    Lockheed Martin (LMT -1.4%) says its board of directors has unanimously voted to establish the...

    Lockheed Martin (LMT -1.4%) says its board of directors has unanimously voted to establish the new position of vice chairman, electing President and COO Christopher Kubasik to the post effective today. Mr. Kubasik will also succeed Robert Stevens as CEO on January 1, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • ETN

    Cooper Industries (CBE -0.8%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing its...

    Cooper Industries (CBE -0.8%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing its takeover by Eaton. The firm also lowers its price target range to $68 - $72 from $70 - $74.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • OREX

    Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX +13.2%) soars again today on the back of the FDA's approval of Arena...

    Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX +13.2%) soars again today on the back of the FDA's approval of Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) Belviq weight loss drug. JPMorgan ups the stock to Overweight, saying it "stands to be the biggest beneficiary" as approval for its own weight loss drug, Contrave, is still far off, which leaves a valuation gap with rivals whose drugs are closer to approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 32 Comments
  • HUSA

    Houston American Energy (HUSA -18.1%) shares plummet after the firm's operational update of its...

    Houston American Energy (HUSA -18.1%) shares plummet after the firm's operational update of its Cachirre #1 well. HUSA's development partners elect to cease testing the well and propose to abandon it, so the company will test the well at its "sole risk."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    The momo knife is out in full force today in the retail sector, with favored names such as...

    The momo knife is out in full force today in the retail sector, with favored names such as Chipotle (CMG -4.1%), Lululemon (LULU -7.7%), Under Armour (UA -2.9%), and Monster Beverage (MNST -5.6%) all getting whacked lower on heavy volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) -30% and extending its losses from AH trading yesterday after...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) -30% and extending its losses from AH trading yesterday after disclosing mixed interim results from a Phase IIb/III trial of its ganetespib treatment for lung cancer. Synta is assessing the drug in combination with docetaxel, a leading chemotherapy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -5.8%) is the latest of several MLP secondary offerings, and more...

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -5.8%) is the latest of several MLP secondary offerings, and more are sure to come as pipeline companies expand into areas such as North Dakota, Ohio and Michigan where pipelines are relatively scarce. At least 50 MLPs are involved in pipelines, propane distribution and shipping, and all need to raise capital almost constantly.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 7 Comments
  • GHDX

    Piper Jaffray says the Supreme Court's decision is positive for companies exposed to doctors'...

    Piper Jaffray says the Supreme Court's decision is positive for companies exposed to doctors' offices, with Genomic Health (GHDX -0.8%) likely the biggest beneficiary. Other names that should benefit include: Gen-Probe (GPRO +0.1%), Hologic (HOLX -1.6%), Qiagen (QGEN -1.8%), EXACT Sciences (EXAS -2.8%) and Meriad Genetics (MYGN +0.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • MDT

    The Supreme Court opinion on the Healthcare Act means that medical device makers still face a...

    The Supreme Court opinion on the Healthcare Act means that medical device makers still face a 2.3% tax on domestic sales starting next year unless they can persuade Congress to repeal it. Shares are sliding: MDT -1.2%, BSX -2.7%, STJ -1%, EW 1.1%, SYK -1.9%, ATRC -4.7%, CYBX -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +2.1%) is rallying on an upgrade to Buy from ThinkEquity, which is setting a $30 PT....

    Cree (CREE +2.1%) is rallying on an upgrade to Buy from ThinkEquity, which is setting a $30 PT. LED rival SemiLEDs (LEDS +3.6%), which just settled a patent dispute with Cree, is also moving higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • AET

    Wells Fargo is saying to buy managed care names on the back of the Supreme Court decision. The...

    Wells Fargo is saying to buy managed care names on the back of the Supreme Court decision. The firm notes that the decision removes a big overhang in the sector and is actually a positive over the long term. Top names it recommends buying: Aetna (AET -4%), Coventry Health (CVH -3.6%), Humana (HUM -3.2%) and UnitedHealth (UNH -3.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • TAHO

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO -19.3%) is sharply lower on reports Guatemala is seeking a 40% stake in...

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO -19.3%) is sharply lower on reports Guatemala is seeking a 40% stake in mining companies, although losses have eased a bit after the company's resources VP downplays concerns, saying there "hasn't been anything actually passed" or proposed in Guatemalan law. All of Tahoe's mineral properties and equipment are situated in Guatemala.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • CELL

    BrightPoint (CELL +11.6%) surges after Zacks upgrades shares to Neutral. The firm notes...

    BrightPoint (CELL +11.6%) surges after Zacks upgrades shares to Neutral. The firm notes BrightPoint has recently won orders from MetroPCS, Sprint, and others, helping offset a major recent U.S. customer loss. Separately, BrightPoint has announced a logistics deal with FreedomPop, which is hatching plans to offer free 4G services over Clearwire's network.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • ANF

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +2.2%) shoot higher, bucking an overall lackluster market...

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +2.2%) shoot higher, bucking an overall lackluster market trend. The company hasn't released any news of note, but has grabbed the attention of media outlets as one of its marketing videos has gone viral on YouTube and provided the ANF brand a little low-cost boost in the process.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • AMED

    Home-health and hospice services provider Amedisys (AMED -12.4%) is an outlier in the healthcare...

    Home-health and hospice services provider Amedisys (AMED -12.4%) is an outlier in the healthcare sector this morning, getting slammed hard on heavy volume after being downgraded to Sell at CRT Capital. The stock has rallied over 30% in the past month since hitting rock bottom in May, after being under pressure for weeks over concerns about the future of Medicare home nursing reimbursement.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • AZN

    Pharmaceutical stocks are down following the Supreme Court healthcare opinion, although not...

    Pharmaceutical stocks are down following the Supreme Court healthcare opinion, although not dramatically: AZN -0.4%, GSK -1.6%, SNY -0.8%, PFE -0.8%, ABT -0.8%, MRK -0.7%, LLY -1%, WPI -0.9%, NVS -0.7%, JNJ -0.4%. iShares Dow Jones US Healthcare ETF (NYSEARCA:IYH) -0.95%, the Health Care SPDR (NYSEARCA:XLV) is -1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -6.4%) spike lower off a rumor floating around that David Einhorn has...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -6.4%) spike lower off a rumor floating around that David Einhorn has taken a short position.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • HCA

    Hospital operators are soaring following the Supreme Court opinion validating most of the...

    Hospital operators are soaring following the Supreme Court opinion validating most of the Healthcare Act, although they're down from intial highs. HCA +6.5%, CYH +7.9%, UHS +2.85%, THC +6.9%, LPNT +4.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • MUX

    McEwen Mining (MUX -5%) provides a resource update at its Los Azules copper project in...

    McEwen Mining (MUX -5%) provides a resource update at its Los Azules copper project in Argentina, with estimated contained copper metal in the indicated resource category increasing by 109% to 4.6B lbs. MUX signs a contract with Major Drilling to provide four core drills and one reverse-circulation drill for the 2012-13 drill season.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +2.5%) show strength with more M&A chatter swirling about. Seemingly...

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +2.5%) show strength with more M&A chatter swirling about. Seemingly lost in all the shuffle of activist investors muscling in and out is the firm's financials, although Fitch did weigh in with lowered ratings on Navistar's senior debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • AET

    Healthcare stocks that are down following the Supreme Court opinion on the Healthcare Act...

    Healthcare stocks that are down following the Supreme Court opinion on the Healthcare Act include: CVH -1.3%, UNH -1.1%, AET -1.2%, CI -1.5%, CHSI -0.5%, WLP -2.5%, HUM -2%. Those that are up include: UAM +0.8%, MOH +6.3%, HNT +3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD +2.3%) bounces off its 52-week lows after Needham's Alex Henderson launches...

    Riverbed (RVBD +2.3%) bounces off its 52-week lows after Needham's Alex Henderson launches coverage with a Strong Buy and $25 PT. Henderson touts Riverbed's valuation (13.3x estimated 2013 EPS), and attributes some of its recent woes to its sales force's efforts to sell products other than Riverbed's core WAN optimization gear. He thinks a recent sales reorg will right the ship. Yesterday, Jefferies upgraded Riverbed to Hold on valuation grounds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy (TLM +3.2%) decides not to proceed in the next phase of Sasol's (SSL -0.7%)...

    Talisman Energy (TLM +3.2%) decides not to proceed in the next phase of Sasol's (SSL -0.7%) gas-to-liquids plant in western Canada after concluding a feasibility study. "Talisman's immediate focus is to accelerate investment in near-term liquids opportunities, with the goal of increasing liquids and oil-linked gas production to 300K bbl/day by 2015," TLM says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • TPX

    Mattress stocks get a boost with fresh data out showing that May bedding sales increased over...

    Mattress stocks get a boost with fresh data out showing that May bedding sales increased over 18% in May. Longbow says that the trend should continue through June and July as it backs its Buy-rated picks Tempur Pedic (NYSE:TPX) and Select Comfort (SCSS). Advancers: TPX +3.9%, SCSS +4.5%, MFRM +3.1%, ZZ +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • EBAY

    A downbeat note from ITG Research is taking a toll on eBay (EBAY -2.6%) which has outperformed...

    A downbeat note from ITG Research is taking a toll on eBay (EBAY -2.6%) which has outperformed during the recent tech selloff. ITG says its checks indicate macro trends are affecting eBay's ASPs, and resulting in a modest slowdown in e-commerce activity. It expects eBay to post Q2 revenue of $3.29B, below a consensus of $3.36B.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • VRTX

    Vertex (NASDAQ:VRTX) -9.5% despite a mid-stage study showing that a combination of its VX-80 and...

    Vertex (NASDAQ:VRTX) -9.5% despite a mid-stage study showing that a combination of its VX-80 and Kalydeco drugs for cystic fibrosis helped improve lung function in patients. "The highest dose arm looks good,” says ISI analyst Mark Schoenebaum, who reiterates his "buy" rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • DLB

    Dolby (DLB -3.8%) slumps after Goldman starts coverage with a Sell and $39 PT. The firm is...

    Dolby (DLB -3.8%) slumps after Goldman starts coverage with a Sell and $39 PT. The firm is worried about Dolby's lower revenue/unit from mobile devices relative to PCs and home entertainment gear, questions the extent of consumer interest in "premium sound" on smartphones and tablets. It also thinks Dolby's reliance on consumer discretionary spending could hurt its near-term results.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +2.4%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $18 target price at Capstone...

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +2.4%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $18 target price at Capstone Investments, which cites the rapidly expanding adoption of natural gas by the transportation industry after years of promise. CLNE fuels at least 530 fleet customers and 25K vehicles/day at ~273 strategic locations across the U.S. with a broad customer base.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 8 Comments
  • AOL

    AOL (AOL +2.7%) pops after announcing its anticipated stock buyback, the fruits of its $1.056B...

    AOL (AOL +2.7%) pops after announcing its anticipated stock buyback, the fruits of its $1.056B Microsoft patent windfall. The buyback will occur in the form of a $400M Dutch auction tender offer featuring a price range of $27-$30 (AOL currently trades at $28.05), and which is good through August 2. AOL claims the buyback is just the first step in returning all of the patent proceeds to shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD +5.5%) jumps after being upgraded all the way from Underperform to Buy...

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD +5.5%) jumps after being upgraded all the way from Underperform to Buy by BofA/Merrill. The firm cites a low valuation and the potential for stronger sales to Microsoft, which uses DRIV's solutions to handle online software downloads. The company, which has drawn the interest of George Soros, came into the week trading near its 52-week low.
